definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: I sat at my open window with a fresh wreath on my loose hair.
sentences.chinese: 我在散發上戴上新鮮的花串，坐在洞開的窗前。

sentences.english: With the windows wide open , they felt cold in the house .
sentences.chinese: 窗戶洞開，他們在房子裏冷極了。

sentences.english: The doors open in early evening.
sentences.chinese: 那些門在黃昏裏洞開着。
